Welcome to decodes’s documentation!¶

Contents:

decodes.makeOut(outtype, name='untitled', path=False)¶

This function constructs a new outie of the given type.

Parameters:
  • outtype (int (enumerated from Outies class)) – The type of outie to create
  • name (string or “untitled”) – The name of the outie to create. This name is used in different ways, depending on the context to which we will be drawing geometry
  • path (string) – If an outie creates a file, the filepath to save to.
Return type:

child of decodes.outies.outie

decodes.core¶

This is something I want to say that is not in the docstring.

base.py¶

class decodes.core.base.Basis¶

a base class for anything that wants to call itself a basis bases must impliment the folloiwng methods:

eval(other)¶

other should be any object with either “x,y,z” attributes, “x,y” attributes, or a single “t” attribute which may be interpreted by the basis in order to generate a valid baseless point in R3

class decodes.core.base.Geometry¶

a base geometry class for all other geometry to inherit

class decodes.core.base.HasBasis¶

a base class for anything that wants to define a basis for itself

color.py¶

vec.py¶

class decodes.core.vec.Vec(a=0, b=0, c=0)¶

a simple vector class

angle(other)¶

Returns the angle in radians between this vector and the other vector return value is constrained to the range [-PI,PI].

static average(vecs)¶

Returns the average of a list of vectors

static bisector(v0, v1)¶

Returns the normalized bisector of two vectors

cross(other)¶

Return a new vector, the cross product. a x b = (a2b3 - a3b2, a3b1 - a1b3, a1b2 - a2b1) This will be at right angles to both self and other, with a length

len(self) * len(other) * sin(angle_between_them)
dot(other)¶

Computes the dot product of this vector and the other vector

static interpolate(v0, v1, t=0.5)¶

Linearly interpolates between vectors v1 and v2 at param t

inverted()¶

Return a new vector pointing in the opposite direction

length¶

Returns the length of this vector. Use vec.length2 when possible, as it is cheaper to calculate

length2¶

Length squared. Cheaper to calculate than vec.length.

limited(n=1.0)¶

Returns a new vector limited to a given length

normalized(length=1.0)¶

Return a new vector in the same direction, but given length (default 1.0)

projected(other)¶

Returns a new vector projected onto a destination vector

projected_length(other)¶

Returns the length of the vector which results from the projection of this onto other

rounded(n=0)¶

Returns a new vector with coords rounded to n-digits (defaults to 0 digits (nearest int) )

class decodes.core.line.Ray(a, b)¶

class decodes.core.line.LinearEntity(a, b)¶

A linear entity (line, ray, segment, etc) in space.

Warning

This is an abstract class and is not meant to be instantiated.

angle_between(l1, l2)¶

Returns an angle formed between the two linear entities.

Note

Description of Method: From the dot product of vectors v1 and v2 it is known that:

dot(v1, v2) = |v1|*|v2|*cos(A)

where A is the angle formed between the two vectors. We can get the directional vectors of the two lines and readily find the angle between the two using the above formula.

Todo

Implement this method.

coefficients¶

The coefficients (a,b,c) of this line for equation ax+by+c=0

is_concurrent(*lines)¶

Returns True if the set of linear entities are concurrent, False otherwise. Two or more linear entities are concurrent if they all intersect at a single point.

Note

Description of Method: First, take the first two lines and find their intersection. If there is no intersection, then the first two lines were parallel and had no intersection so concurrenecy is impossible amongst the whole set. Otherwise, check to see if the intersection point of the first two lines is a member on the rest of the lines. If so, the lines are concurrent.

Todo

Implement this method.

is_perpendicular(l1, l2)¶

parallel_line(p)¶

Returns a new Line which is parallel to this linear entity and passes through the specified point.

perpendicular_line(p)¶

Returns a new Line which is perpendicular to this linear entity and passes through the specified point.

Todo

Implement this method.

perpendicular_segment(p)¶

Returns a new Segment which connects p to a point on this linear entity and is also perpendicular to this line. Returns p itself if p is on this linear entity.

Todo

Implement this method.

xform.py¶

class decodes.core.xform.Xform(value=1.0, matrix=None)¶

A transformation matrix class.

static change_basis(csSource, csTarget)¶

Warning

This method currently relies on access to the Rhinocommon Kernel. It will not work in other contexts.

Todo

Re-implement this method without using the Rhinocommon Kernel.

static mirror(plane='worldXY')¶

Produces mirror transform Can pass in “worldXY”, “worldYZ”, or “worldXZ” Or, pass in an arbitrary cs (produces mirror about XYplane of CS)

Warning

When mirroring about an arbitrary plane, this method currently relies on access to the Rhinocommon Kernel. It will not work in other contexts.

Todo

Re-implement this method without using the Rhinocommon Kernel.

Warning

This method currently relies on access to the Rhinocommon Kernel. It will not work in other contexts.
